No quick actions or live indicators

lessons_learned.avoid_crm_bloat: Original implementation fell into CRM trap of adding 'helpful' extras that users didn't ask for
lessons_learned.focus_on_requirements: Stick exactly to specified metrics - don't add progress bars, breakdowns, or extra sections
lessons_learned.simplicity_wins: Users want to glance and understand key metrics quickly, not analyze complex dashboards
lessons_learned.less_is_more: 18 focused data points beat 40+ elements with multiple subsections

design_philosophy.primary_goal: Speed and clarity over comprehensive analytics
design_philosophy.user_experience: 3-second glance should reveal all critical information
design_philosophy.visual_hierarchy: Simple metric cards with clear numbers and minimal decorations
design_philosophy.interaction_model: View metrics, not manipulate complex interfaces

essential_ux_elements.loading_states: Simple skeleton loading for metric cards only - no fancy animations
essential_ux_elements.error_handling: Clear error messages with retry option - 'Unable to load clinic data'
essential_ux_elements.data_freshness: 'Last updated: [timestamp]' at top for user trust in AI-powered data
essential_ux_elements.mobile_responsive: Healthcare staff use phones/tablets - responsive grid is essential
essential_ux_elements.empty_states: Handle new clinics or data gaps - 'No data available for this period'
essential_ux_elements.one_action_only: Patient Insights quick link to high-risk patients list (as specified)

ux_elements_to_avoid.quick_actions_everywhere: Only the one specified quick link
ux_elements_to_avoid.detailed_status: No system health or complex status displays
ux_elements_to_avoid.live_indicators: Simple 'last updated' timestamp instead of pulsing dots
